introPanels.message: Tom, a meticulous farmer, has segregated his farm produce to sell to the grocers.
Bob seems to have toppled all the baskets, scattering all the produce.
Help Arya put these edible parts of plants back into their respective baskets to save Bob from the farmerâ€™s fury.

questionText: Help Arya put the edible parts of plants into the appropriate baskets.
positiveFeedback:
Yay! Radish and turnip are considered roots because they grow under the ground and absorb large amounts of nutrients from the soil.

Onion and ginger are underground parts of the stem that have thickened to store food.
negativeFeedback:
Oops! Onion and ginger are not roots.They have nodes, internodes, buds and scale leaves.
Radish and turnip are not stems as they are not derived from stem tissues.

questionText: Help Arya put the edible parts of plants into the appropriate baskets.
positiveFeedback:
Yay! Beet and cauliflower are considered vegetables because they develop from other parts of a plant rather than the ovary and do not contain seeds.

Okra and tomato are considered fruits because they are seed-bearing structures that develop from the ovary of a flowering plant.
negativeFeedback: Uh-oh! Okra and tomato are not vegetables. They contain seeds and are developed from the ovary.
Beet and cauliflower are not fruits. They do not contain seeds and are developed from other parts of a plant rather than the ovary.

completionText: Good job! You helped Arya segregate the edible parts of plants to their correct places!
